intro: Pavonia ionthacarpa, commonly known as the redroot pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a rough, hairy texture. Pavonia ionthacarpa is often found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woodlands.
